Description: Upper body sherd of probably Clazomenian black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: from top, glaze band with crescents in added white; black-figure decoration consisting of woman flute-player to right (lower body missing; white on skin, aulos and dots on skirt; added red for fillet and on chiton); at right, white hand holding a wreath of second female, facing left.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see British Museum 1888,0208.66. NAA analysis carried out H. Mommsen (see Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006), sample Nauk 69, but its provenance remains uncertain.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.11)

Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.019) (Phase 1)
